stories.headline: REMOTE SENSING: Images boost GIS work
stories.summary: The article discusses how GIS-savvy journalists can enhance their work with remote sensing techniques, using the example of The St. Louis Post-Dispatch, which revealed Missouri's significant flood-plain development after the 1993 flood using satellite imagery.

stories.headline: SPOTLIGHT: CITY GOVERNMENT: Data-based approach reaps great stories
stories.summary: Michael Mansur shares his journey from spreadsheet illiteracy to effectively using them for reporting on local government, highlighting how data analysis can uncover hidden stories.

stories.headline: INTRANETS: Newsroom data depots no longer a luxury
stories.summary: The article explores how searchable databases on newsroom intranets have transitioned from being novel to being essential, elaborating on the types of data commonly stored and their utility in reporting.

stories.headline: Bits & Bytes: Updated files
stories.summary: Details updates to the IRE and NICAR Database Library, including new data on FDA Adverse Events and NASA Air Safety Reporting, highlighting their potential use in investigative journalism.
